alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 1:53PM MST until February 08 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Natrona County in central Wyoming... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 153 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 10 miles northwest of Midwest, or 17 miles southeast of Kaycee, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 198 and 234. Locations impacted include... Midwest, Homa Hills, Edgerton, Antelope Hills and Teapot Rock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
